TextView.android:text:
This app will connect your Android device any OS version to Raspberry Pi3 

You will need to install Blue manager in the Pi3: sudo apt-get install bluetooth bluez blueman
 Pair you mobile device and the Pi3 using Blue prior test the app.

 Prior execute, please run a terminal window on the Pi and get your MAC address: sudo hciconfig.

 Then download and extract to your Pi the following Python scrip at: www.crhostservices.com/btpython/btpi3_receiver.rar

 Execute the script from the folder you saved it: sudo python btpi3_receiver.py

 Now go back to the app main screen and select your Pi3 mac address, you should be connected shortly to the Pi.

 Enter data to send to the Pi3 either by typing or using voice commands, once sent you will get the same data replied from the pi. Type/Say 'exit to stop the connection. 

 You can modify the script as required, enjoy Marco C.
